description: {"blocks":[{"key":"778dv","text":"In the present protocol, we provide a step-by-step protocol with all the critical information to perform an intestinal ligated loop in a mouse model. Using this technique, we describe the infection of intestinal loop with C. difficile spores and immunofluorescence of whole mounted intestinal tissue to study the interaction of C. difficile spores with the intestinal mucosa. Also, this work provides information of the processing and mounting of the tissues to acquire high-resolution confocal images, and that may be used to quantify the spore adherence and internalization to the intestinal mucosa.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":222,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":327,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f6uj5","text":"With a disposable razor, shave the abdominal zone.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Mouse preparation for surgery (steps 8–17). This video shows how to anesthetize the mouse, apply ophthalmic solution, disinfect, and shave the abdomen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"38003A85D39011EBB157123DB32C8755","url":"https://www.dropbox.com/s/bnnu71l2rewa220/S1_Video.mp4?dl=0"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"460il","text":"Using forceps and a surgical scissor sharp/blunt, perform an incision of ~  in the midline of the abdominal skin (Fig 2B).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":114,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":74,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"28krd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"thickness","mutability":"","data":{"error":false,"guid":"AEE3A7D0D3A211EB93849793CF30FBD4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":200,"value":"2"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9e6rf","text":"The skin is separated from the peritoneum using anatomical forceps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ae09h","text":"Identify the linea alba, a semitransparent longitudinally white line in the peritoneum (Fig 2C).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":88,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"862a4","text":"Open the abdominal cavity, incise the abdominal musculature on the linea alba. For this, gently grab the musculature with anatomical forceps and retracting up. The abdominal organs are not adjacent to the muscles. Using a scissor or a scalpel makes a small opening into the peritoneal cavity in the linea alba. Extend the incision in the midline until it reaches the size of the skin cut. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"el1sc","text":"Using forceps, gently move the intestines to identify the cecum, a large J-shaped blind sac curved. Extract the cecum through the incision and identify the ileum and colon (Fig 3A). The ileum is the distal last part of the small intestine that is attached to the cavity by mesentery tissue that derives blood supply from the mesenteric artery. The proximal colon is the first part of the colon that begins in the cecum.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":173,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":419,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1lt07","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"663670C0D38F11EB9136376CE2C64663","height":358,"id":117909,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":88,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"9r0pn","text":"Fig 3. Identification of regions of interest to perform ligations between blood vessels.(A) Identification of ileum and colon using as reference the cecum. The regions of interest to be ligated are indicated with dotted lines. The yellow line and blue line denote the first and second ligation, respectively. Ligations are spaced ~1.5 cm. The ligatures with surgical silk sutures were performed between the intestine and the blood vessels. The identification of regions of interest are shown in (B) ileum and (C) proximal colon. As a reference, the first ligation was performed close to the cecum.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Fig_3.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dvez9tc6.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dvex9tc6.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dvey9tc6.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dvew9tc6.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e7136","text":"When the ileum or colon has fecal material, it can be removed, pressing gently with a blunt tip of the forceps against your fingers and move it in the direction of the flow of the fecal material or to the cecum.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"30hom","text":"In the ileum, identify regions to be ligated where blood vessels are finely separated from the ileum's external wall (Fig 3B). Once identified, pass the fine tip of the Dumont Nº5 Forceps between the outer wall of the ileum and the blood vessels having care of not damage or puncture the blood vessels. With the tip of the Dumont Nº5 Forceps, on the other side of the hole formed between the external wall of the ileum and the blood vessels, grasp the thread of the surgical suture, and gently pass to the other side of the hole.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":118,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"65kfm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9fr05","text":"Perform a firm but gentle double \"simple knot,\" performing a blind knot so as not to cut the tissue and having special care of not ligate neither interfering with the blood flow.Note: When necessary, hydrate the intestines with drops of sterile saline solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1o3bg","text":"A second ligation is then performed at ~   of distance from the first ligation using the same strategy described above (Fig 3B). However, in this case, perform a simple knot without closing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":120,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c9k9o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"thickness","mutability":"","data":{"error":false,"guid":"0B174A50D38C11EB9136376CE2C64663","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":200,"value":"1.5"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5u51f","text":"At  –  out of the second ligation, insert the  needle of a tuberculin syringes with 5×108 C. difficile spores in  of saline in the direction of the ligation and cross the ligation by inside the intestine the and close the knot with the syringe needle inside. C. difficile spores strain R20291 (CM210) were purified as was described previously (Calderón-Romero et. al. 2018)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":88,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":90,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":259,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":3,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":5,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":113,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"uc9r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"563hr","text":" {"blocks":[{"key":"7m9ct","text":"Release the C. difficile spores inside the loop, keeping the pressure in the knot. This is performed to avoid inoculum loss and splashing that occurs when the ligated loop is injected directly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":12,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4g6fj","text":"Remove the syringe and close the ligation with a simple double knot. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1krio","text":"To perform the colonic loop, identify the regions to be ligated (Fig 3C) and repeat the points 24–31 in the proximal colon.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":65,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a67lm","text":"Carefully using anatomical forceps return intestines to the abdominal cavity. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6kkbl","text":"Close the peritoneum of the abdominal wall by a continuous or interrupted suture using silk suture.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"febgn","text":"Close the skin of the abdominal wall by continuous or interrupted suture using silk suture.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b4d5l","text":"Remove mice from the isoflurane mask and from the heating pad and allow the mouse to recover from the anesthesia under a heat lamp. The awareness recovery usually takes  – .  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":169,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":171,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d8q3j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"07815AE0D3A311EB93849793CF30FBD4","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"0FF18AB0D3A311EB93849793CF30FBD4","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c6rv8","text":"Apply postoperative analgesia when required according to the animal care protocol at your institution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8jfho","text":"Usually, the complete procedure for one mouse and one loop takes ~ : and with 2 loops ~ . Animals were kept in the cage for 5h with free access to water and close to a heat lamp. Animals were monitored every  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":66,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":87,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":208,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2j3af","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"384BE500D3A311EB93849793CF30FBD4","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"3BB94660D3A311EB93849793CF30FBD4","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"3F9DAC80D3A311EB93849793CF30FBD4","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fqc0u","text":"Depth anesthesia is induced by isoflurane inhalation, as is indicated above in step 9.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4kqc9","text":"Check anesthetic depth by non-response to hind limb toe pinch.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3huo4","text":"Perform cervical dislocation by separating the vertebrae in the cervical area with a firm pinch to the neck using a rigid metallic tool and firmly pull the mouse from the tail. The separation of the skull and brain from the spinal cord is caused by anterior pressure applied in the skull base.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"440od","text":"Using forceps, gently grab the skin and retract it up, so the abdominal organs and the ligated loops are not adjacent to the muscles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"914dm","text":"Using scissors, open the abdominal cavity, cutting the skin and peritoneum. Extend the incision to visualize the intestines and the loops.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

However, sample mounting is essential to identify the tissue orientation. For this:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ecbiu","text":"Using forceps, place the samples in a clean glass slide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"59cks","text":"First, using a light -upright or -inverted microscope with 20× or 40× magnification coupled to epifluorescence with a blue filter to visualize Hoechst 33342 staining, orientate the tissues to put the liminal side up as follow.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"59o7g","text":"Clean the coverslips and slides with   ethanol and towel paper.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":37,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"54i09","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"70","error_concentration":false,"guid":"69CA4710D3A911EB93849793CF30FBD4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4hinh","text":"Using towel paper removes the excess PBS from the edges of the tissues.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6f808","text":"In a new clean glass slide, using a  –  micropipette, put a drop of   of fluorescent mounting medium for each tissue to be mounted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":38,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":68,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"de4ht","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48j6q","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bmr7t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"7ACF1EA0D3A911EB93849793CF30FBD4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"7CE10EB0D3A911EB93849793CF30FBD4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"7F62B080D3A911EB93849793CF30FBD4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"","data":{"id":951763,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Fluorescence Mounting Medium","linfor":"","url":"https://www.agilent.com/en/product/immunohistochemistry/ancillaries-for-ihc/mounting-media/fluorescence-mounting-medium-76745","sku":"S3023","cas_number":"","rrid":"","public":0,"can_edit":1,"guid":"F5F72D10D3AA11EB93849793CF30FBD4","in_steps":null,"vendor":{"id":411,"name":"Dako","link":"https://www.agilent.com/en-de/dako-products","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5mful","text":"Using forceps put the tissues over the drops of the mounting medium of the clean slide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2f4kr","text":"Using a  –  micropipette, put   of fluorescent mounting medium over the tissues having care of not to damage the tissue with the tip of the micropipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":10,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":30,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b63et","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"23972B30D3AB11EB93849793CF30FBD4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"2743DF80D3AB11EB93849793CF30FBD4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"15","error":false,"guid":"29B9C180D3AB11EB93849793CF30FBD4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2to1t","text":"Put Scotch transparent tape (3M, USA) on the upper and lower edges of the coverslip, leaving half of the Scotch transparent tape on the coverslips and the other half free.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4s9ag","text":"Put a coverslip over the samples, not allowing air bubbles to remain in the tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b5ene","text":"With your fingers, fold the piece of Scotch transparent tape under the slide firmly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eikut","text":"Seal the remaining edges with Scotch transparent tape.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fi4r5","text":"Store the samples at    , and then the samples are ready to visualize under confocal microscopy.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":23,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8c1sc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1oc3t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3om56","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"35FF1530D3AB11EB93849793CF30FBD4","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":10800,"guid":"3FE654A0D3AB11EB93849793CF30FBD4","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9206d","text":"Note: After mounting, we usually observe the samples as soon as possible and with no more than 1 week because sometimes samples begin to dry, making impossible the confocal visualization. warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"2iij7","text":"Biosafety and personal protection elements","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5e01a","text":"During the surgery, the use of personal protective equipment is required, such as a disposable laboratory coat, goggles, gloves, cap, and mask when you are manipulating the fixing solution. The surgery is not performed under the biological safety cabinet. However, processes that produce aerosol, such as preparing the syringe with C. difficilespore inoculum, opening and cleaning the tissues infected withC. difficile spores, were performed under the biosafety cabinet. Finally, all the used surfaces were disinfected with a solution of 0.5% bleach and 1:200  Virkon-S.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":332,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":406,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
